DataElement.preferredName: Person Myocardial Infarction Unstable Angina Post Pazopanib Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has experienced a myocardial infarction, gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, or unstable angina, a change in frequency, duration, or intensity of angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort), after having received a prior administration of pazopanib, a small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity that works by selectively inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptors (VEGFR)-1, -2 and -3, c-kit and platelet derived growth factor receptor as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Myocardial Infarction Unstable Angina Post Pazopanib Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having experienced a myocardial infarction, gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, or unstable angina, a change in frequency, duration, or intensity of angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort), after having received a prior administration of pazopanib, a small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity that works by selectively inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptors (VEGFR)-1, -2 and -3, c-kit and platelet derived growth factor receptor as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Myocardial Infarction Unstable Angina Post Pazopanib Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area. (Dorland, 27th ed):Angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort) which has recently changed in frequency, duration, intensity, or occurs at rest.:Post; occuring after.:A small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity. Pazopanib selectively inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptors (VEGFR)-1, -2 and -3, c-kit and platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGF-R), which may result in inhibition of angiogenesis in tumors in which these receptors are upregulated.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.
Angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort) which has recently changed in frequency, duration, intensity, or occurs at rest.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity. Pazopanib selectively inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptors (VEGFR)-1, -2 and -3, c-kit and platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGF-R), which may result in inhibition of angiogenesis in tumors in which these receptors are upregulated.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
